alert.note: Alert for Debeque to Silt Corridor; Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS GrandJunction (Western Colorado and Eastern Utah)
info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued September 30 at 2:51PM MDT by NWS GrandJunction
info.description: ...Strong thunderstorms will impact portions of northwestern Mesa, southwestern Garfield and southern Rio Blanco Counties through 315 PM MDT... At 250 PM MDT, Doppler radar was tracking a line of strong thunderstorms extending from 33 miles south of Rangely to 30 miles northwest of Grand Junction to 9 miles west of Fruita. Movement was east at 40 mph. HAZARD...Wind gusts of 50 to 55 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. These storms will remain over mainly rural areas of northwestern Mesa, southwestern Garfield and southern Rio Blanco Counties, including the following locations... Mack, Loma and Redlands. This includes the following highways... Interstate 70 in Colorado between mile markers 9 and 24. Colorado 139 between mile markers 1 and 41. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...55 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with these storms and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways. Frequent cloud to ground lightning is occurring with these storms. Lightning can strike 10 miles away from a thunderstorm. Seek a safe shelter inside a building or vehicle.

area.areaDesc: Debeque to Silt Corridor; Lower Yampa River Basin; Roan and Tavaputs Plateaus
